intro: Rhagadiolus leiocarpus, commonly known as the white-barked tamarind, is a small evergreen tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its smooth, whitish bark and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody, egg-shaped pods containing seeds. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
